Class Project

java.lang.Object
Project
public class Project extends Object
The Project class contains all methods related to project information.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Minal

  • Method Details

    • deadlineUpdate

      public static void deadlineUpdate​(int projectNum, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Method to update a projects deadline Requests new deadline in the format DD/MM/YYYY Deadline for the project is updated in the database
      Parameters:
      projectNum - is the project number of the project that will be updated
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • totalPaidUpdate

      public static void totalPaidUpdate​(int projectNum, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Method to update the total paid The user is requested to enter the new total paid. If 0 is entered, the request is cancelled. If the amount is less than the total paid or greater than the total cost, the program will request the user to enter it again. The projects total paid will be update in the database if the input is valid
      Parameters:
      projectNum - is the project number of the project that will be updated
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • AddProject

      public static void AddProject​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      This method is used to add a new project to the database. The user is requested to enter the details of the project to create a new project.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • incompleteProjects

      public static void incompleteProjects​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      This method displays a list of all incomplete projects. The method queries the projects table in the database and retrieves projects where the status is 'Incomplete'. The project number, name and deadline of each of these projects are displayed.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • delayedProjects

      public static void delayedProjects​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      This method displays a list of all projects that are past their due dates. The method queries the projects table in the database and retrieves projects where the deadline has passed. The project number, name, deadline and status of each of these projects are displayed.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • projectFinalized

      public static void projectFinalized​(int projectNum, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      This method is used to finalize a project. The method will change the status of the project to "Finalized on YYYY-MM-DD", where YYYY-MM-DD is the date on which it was finalized. If the project has not been fully paid for, an invoice will be generated showing the customers details and the amount outstanding. The details of the project will also be saved to a text file "Completed Project - Project Name".
      Parameters:
      projectNum - is the project number of the project that will be updated
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException
      thrown - if an error occurs in writing to the text file.

    • projectNumSearch

      public static int projectNumSearch​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Searches for a project by project number. User is requested to enter a project number. The method queries the projects table in the database to find the matching project number. If it does not find the project, it displays a message requesting the number again.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Returns:
      a project number
      Throws:
      SQLException
      thrown - when an invalid character is inputted for type integer

    • projectNameSearch

      public static int projectNameSearch​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Searches for a project by project name. User is requested to enter a project name. The method queries the projects table in the database to find the matching project name. If it does not find the project, it displays a message requesting the name again.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Returns:
      a project number
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • projectSelect

      public static int projectSelect​(Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Creates a list of all the project allowing the user to select a project A numbered list of all the projects is created and using the integerInput() method, the user selects a project.
      Parameters:
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Returns:
      a project number
      Throws:
      SQLException
      See Also:
      integerInput()

    • idNum

      public static String idNum​(String tableName, String identifier, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Creates ID numbers for projects and role players The ID numbers are unique identifiers to be used in the tables. The method checks how many non null rays exist to determine the next number. The number is then attached to the role players identifier (e.g. CS for customer, A for architect, etc.)
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the table for which a new ID is created
      identifier - used to identify different role players
      statement - is for sending queries to the database
      Returns:
      string ID number for the new project or role player
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • displayProject

      public static String displayProject​(int projNum, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Creates a string to displays a projects details including all role players information The method queries the database to obtain the project information and then uses the displayPerson method to obtain each role players information. The information is then saved to a string variable.
      Parameters:
      projNum - project number of the project that will be displayed.
      statement - statement is for sending queries to the database
      Returns:
      a string containing the project information
      Throws:
      SQLException
      See Also:
      displayPerson()
